へらへら: (へらへら) - (sometimes 〜な) foolishly (laughing)/thoughtlessly (smiling); indiscreetly (talking)/carelessly (speaking)/frivolously/flippantly; thin (paper, cloth, etc.)/weak-bodied; flaring up/bursting into flames
へろへろ: (へろへろ) - completely exhausted; dog-tired; dreadfully weary; terribly frustrated; limp; weak; flimsy
へん: (へん) - suffix used to negate a verb in the non-past tense; humph/hmph
べ: (べえ) - word used at sentence-end (like a particle) to indicate speculation, volition or invitation; (ぺ only) familiar suffix used after a personal name
べか船: (べかぶね) - small sailing boat used for collecting nori, etc.
べきではない: (べきではない) - should not; must not
べく: (べく) - in order to/for the purpose of; must/should
べし見: (べしみ) - beshimi; noh mask with a slanted mouth, bulging eyes and large nostrils
べそをかく: (べそをかく) - to be ready to cry; to be on the point of tears
べそを作る: (べそをつくる) - to be ready to cry; to be on the point of tears
べた: (ベタ) - (usu. as べたに) covering/filled in/gapless/all over; (before a noun) complete/total; cliched/clichéd/hackneyed/corny/predictable; plaintext; solid printing/solid typesetting; contact print
べたべた: (べたべた) - sticky; all over; clinging (e.g. of a person)/following around; cliched/hackneyed
べた付く: (べたつく) - to be sticky; to be close together
べた焼き: (べたやき) - contact print; pancake topped with vegetables, etc.
べた組み: (べたぐみ) - solid printing; solid typesetting
べた褒め: (べたほめ) - high praise; eulogy; rave review
べた負け: (べたまけ) - complete defeat; losing all matches
べちゃべちゃ: (べちょべちょ) - chattering; prattling; gooey; messy (from mud, ink, etc.)
べちょべちょ: (べちょべちょ) - chattering; prattling; gooey; messy (from mud, ink, etc.)
べっこう飴: (べっこうあめ) - hard candy; candy suckers molded on a griddle; tortoise-shell candy
べったら漬: (べったらづけ) - daikon pickled in salted rice yeast
べったら漬け: (べったらづけ) - daikon pickled in salted rice yeast
べったり: (ベッタリ) - sticking/clinging; with a smack (e.g. sitting down)/hard; all over/thickly
べっとり: (べっとり) - sticky/thick (e.g. thickly plastered)/ikky/gummy; to stick closely
べっ甲: (べっこう) - tortoiseshell (of the hawksbill turtle)/bekko; (in Chinese medicine) tortoiseshell (esp. of the Chinese soft-shelled turtle)
べらべら: (べらべら) - non-stop talking/speaking indiscreetly/chattering; thin/flimsy
べろっと: (べろっと) - licking; sticking out one's tongue
べろべろ: (ベロンベロン) - (べろべろ, ベロベロ only)  licking; drunken
べろべろ舐める: (べろべろなめる) - to lick something up; to lap something up
べろんべろん: (ベロンベロン) - (べろべろ, ベロベロ only)  licking; drunken
べんべら: (べんべら) - worn-out silk clothes; cheap items
べーだ: (べーだ) - sound often made when performing the akanbe- (childish and insulting) gesture
べーっだ: (べーだ) - sound often made when performing the akanbe- (childish and insulting) gesture
ぺ: (べえ) - word used at sentence-end (like a particle) to indicate speculation, volition or invitation; (ぺ only) familiar suffix used after a personal name
ぺこぺこ: (ぺこぺこ) - very hungry/starving/famished; fawning/bowing and scraping/being obsequious/being servile/kowtowing/bowing repeatedly/cringing; giving in/being dented
ぺこり: (ぺこりん) - sound of thin metal or plastic surface caving in and springing back; action of quickly bowing or lowering one's head/(with a) bob of the head
ぺこりん: (ぺこりん) - sound of thin metal or plastic surface caving in and springing back; action of quickly bowing or lowering one's head/(with a) bob of the head
ぺこん: (ぺこりん) - sound of thin metal or plastic surface caving in and springing back; action of quickly bowing or lowering one's head/(with a) bob of the head
ぺしゃんこ: (ぺたんこ) - crushed flat/flattened/squashed/flat-topped; flat-chested girl; sound of a sticky rice cake sticking to something
ぺたぺた: (ぺたぺた) - sound of a flat surface repeatedly making contact with something; applying a seal or stamp again and again/pasting (paper) all over; daubing/smearing
ぺたん: (ぺたん) - sound of something making firm contact with a flat surface
ぺたんこ: (ぺたんこ) - crushed flat/flattened/squashed/flat-topped; flat-chested girl; sound of a sticky rice cake sticking to something
ぺちゃくちゃ: (ペチャクチャ) - chattering; chit-chat; (ladies) prattle
ぺちゃぺちゃ: (ぺちゃぺちゃ) - chatter/prattle; sound of juicy food being bitten into
ぺちゃんこ: (ぺたんこ) - crushed flat/flattened/squashed/flat-topped; flat-chested girl; sound of a sticky rice cake sticking to something
ぺったんこ: (ぺたんこ) - crushed flat/flattened/squashed/flat-topped; flat-chested girl; sound of a sticky rice cake sticking to something
ぺっちゃんこ: (ぺたんこ) - crushed flat/flattened/squashed/flat-topped; flat-chested girl; sound of a sticky rice cake sticking to something
ぺっと: (ぺっと) - ptoo (i.e. spitting sound); ptew; ptooey
ぺてん: (ペテン) - fraud (chi: bēngzi, 子); swindle
ぺらっ: (ぺらっ) - flipping (e.g. a page), peel off; fluently
ぺらぺら: (ぺらぺら) - fluent/fluency; flipping (pages); thin or weak (paper, cloth)
ぺりぺり: (ぺりぺり) - light tearing or ripping sound; sound of tearing along perforated lines
ぺろっと: (ぺろっと) - while sticking out one's tongue
ぺろりと: (ぺろっと) - while sticking out one's tongue
ぺろりと平らげる: (ぺろりとたいらげる) - to make short work of; to eat up quickly
ぺんぺん草: (ペンペングサ) - shepherd's purse (Capsella bursa-pastoris)
ぺんぺん草が生える: (ぺんぺんぐさがはえる) - (because shepherd's purse is a weed that often grows in abandoned areas)  to be in ruins; to be dilapidated; to be desolated
ほいほい: (ホイホイ) - recklessly/thoughtlessly/carelessly/readily/blithely/willingly/easily; pamperingly/indulgently/carefully (not angering); shoo!; heave-ho; hallo/hello; novice/beginner
ほい駕籠: (ほいかご) - crude palanquin; street palanquin
ほう: (ホー) - oh/ho/exclamation of surprise, admiration, etc.; hoo (owl call)/toot (sound of a flute)
ほうい: (ほうい) - word used when calling out to somebody far away
ほうの木: (ホウノキ) - magnolia (Magnolia obovata); Japanese big leaf magnolia
ほうほうの体: (ほうほうのてい) - scuttling (to escape in a panic, in shame, etc.); scurrying; scrambling
